sense.name: a small amount of quantity of something
sense.examples: Traces of lead and other heavy metals were found in the town's drinking water. This sauce has just a trace of cumin in it. There are still traces of radioactive particles at the old nuclear test site. A trace of her perfume lingered in the air after she had gone.

sense.name: data which is an indication or evidence for something
sense.examples: The bloodhounds followed the fugitive by the trace of his scent. The ancient city vanished without a trace beneath tons of volcanic ash. There was no trace of sarcasm in John's praise of Mary's achievement. Just the trace of a smile crossed her lips when she mentioned his name.

sense.name: a drawing obtained by copying the outline of an original
sense.examples: Jane made a trace of the Italian fashion pattern. These traces are of 19th-century fabric designs that I copied from an old book onto semi-transparent paper.

sense.name: a procedure to investigate the source of something
sense.examples: The FBI was able to put a trace on the call. Their trace of the computer bug led to some code John compiled into the system last week. The doctor detected no abnormalities in the patient's GI tract, after examining it through a radioactive trace.

sense.name: sum of elements on the principle diagonal of a square matrix
sense.examples: Calculate the trace of the following 3-by-3 matrix.

sense.name: a line connecting a harness to a wagon
sense.examples: The leather traces on the mule team's harness looked worn.
